page.title: 08PAPER MILL AT CHIRNSIDE
page.content: There has been a paper mill at Chirnside Bridge since the 18th century. C H Dexter Limited, the current owners, have manufactured paper here since 1971. The River Whiteadder provides a reliable water supply. Other materials needed are imported from all over the world. They employ 14 women and 194 men with an average weekly take-home pay of Â£123. The work force includes skilled, unskilled and highly specialised workers from the surrounding area. The variety of products manufactured consists of teabags, meat casings, vacuum cleaner bags, surgical masks, drapes and gowns. Their latest product is plugwrap - filters for cigarettes. These products are used by some British companies and are also exported.
